intro: Arrabidaea carabobensis, commonly known as the Carabobo arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Venezuela. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, tropical environments and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink, contributing to its ornamental value.
